RemixTree.title: Writing Automated Questions using WeBWork in ADAPT

original.title: Writing Automated Questions using WeBWork in ADAPT

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Introduces the book, its PGML-first focus, and the intended audience in science and descriptive fields. After finishing, you can see how the chapters fit together and pick a quick-start path. Use it to orient yourself before diving into templates and examples.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Introduces the book, its PGML-first focus, and the intended audience in science and descriptive fields. After finishing, you can see how the chapters fit together and pick a quick-start path. Use it to orient yourself before diving into templates and examples.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Explains what WeBWorK is and how PGML fits into a typical problem. After finishing, you can separate minimal PG setup from the PGML prompt and focus effort in the right place. Use it when you need a clear mental model of what a WeBWorK problem file is doing.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Explains what WeBWorK is and how PGML fits into a typical problem. After finishing, you can separate minimal PG setup from the PGML prompt and focus effort in the right place. Use it when you need a clear mental model of what a WeBWorK problem file is doing.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Describes why WeBWorK works well for repeated practice with immediate feedback in science courses. After finishing, you can decide whether a prompt belongs in WeBWorK and which patterns to prefer for maintainability. Use it when you are choosing between WeBWorK and a simpler question format for a specific activity.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Describes why WeBWorK works well for repeated practice with immediate feedback in science courses. After finishing, you can decide whether a prompt belongs in WeBWorK and which patterns to prefer for maintainability. Use it when you are choosing between WeBWorK and a simpler question format for a specific activity.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Summarizes the features that matter most when building science-friendly prompts. After finishing, you can choose between answer checking approaches, randomization, and interaction patterns without overcomplicating the code. Use it as a checklist when planning a new question.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Summarizes the features that matter most when building science-friendly prompts. After finishing, you can choose between answer checking approaches, randomization, and interaction patterns without overcomplicating the code. Use it as a checklist when planning a new question.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Compares WeBWorK to other automated assessment formats so you can choose an appropriate tool. After finishing, you can recognize when robust parsing and algorithmic variants are worth the setup cost. Use it when you are deciding between WeBWorK and a simpler, more portable question pattern.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Compares WeBWorK to other automated assessment formats so you can choose an appropriate tool. After finishing, you can recognize when robust parsing and algorithmic variants are worth the setup cost. Use it when you are deciding between WeBWorK and a simpler, more portable question pattern.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Sets expectations that regular PG is discouraged and treated as scaffolding for PGML. After finishing, you can keep setup code focused and put student-facing text where it belongs in the PGML block. Use it to keep your problems short, readable, and consistent.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Sets expectations that regular PG is discouraged and treated as scaffolding for PGML. After finishing, you can keep setup code focused and put student-facing text where it belongs in the PGML block. Use it to keep your problems short, readable, and consistent.

children.title: 2.2: PG Problem Files with a .pg file extension

original.title: 2.2: PG Problem Files with a .pg file extension

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Summarizes the PGML features used throughout the book and organizes the PGML subsections. After finishing, you can identify which PGML topic you need next, from math formatting to tables and images. Use it as the entry point before writing or revising any PGML prompt.  SEO tags: PGML markup, PGML chapter, authoring, formatting, science prompts

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Summarizes the PGML features used throughout the book and organizes the PGML subsections. After finishing, you can identify which PGML topic you need next, from math formatting to tables and images. Use it as the entry point before writing or revising any PGML prompt.  SEO tags: PGML markup, PGML chapter, authoring, formatting, science prompts

children.title: 4: Breaking Down the Components of a WeBWorK Problem

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Provides a complete PGML-first example in a science-friendly style. After finishing, you can adapt the template by changing the story, values, and checks while keeping setup code minimal. Use it as a copy-and-edit baseline for building your first small problem set.  SEO tags: worked example, dilution, units, tolerance, randomization, PGML template

original.title: 4: Breaking Down the Components of a WeBWorK Problem

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Provides a complete PGML-first example in a science-friendly style. After finishing, you can adapt the template by changing the story, values, and checks while keeping setup code minimal. Use it as a copy-and-edit baseline for building your first small problem set.  SEO tags: worked example, dilution, units, tolerance, randomization, PGML template

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Introduces common interaction patterns used across many assessment systems and frames them for science prompts. After finishing, you can pick an interaction pattern first and then write a prompt that fits it and grades reliably. Use it when planning a new unit and deciding what kinds of items to include.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Introduces common interaction patterns used across many assessment systems and frames them for science prompts. After finishing, you can pick an interaction pattern first and then write a prompt that fits it and grades reliably. Use it when planning a new unit and deciding what kinds of items to include.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Explains how to apply the Chapter 5 question types to specific scientific subjects. After finishing, you can translate a generic question pattern into a subject-authentic prompt with realistic units and data. Use it as a bridge from generic patterns to biochemistry, genetics, molecular biology, and biostatistics problem writing.

properties.name: mindtouch.page#overview
properties.value: Explains how to apply the Chapter 5 question types to specific scientific subjects. After finishing, you can translate a generic question pattern into a subject-authentic prompt with realistic units and data. Use it as a bridge from generic patterns to biochemistry, genetics, molecular biology, and biostatistics problem writing.
